title: Ok seriously leaverbuster needs to ease up a tad.
body:
Walked out of the room for 4 minutes to have a smoke while i waited for a huge lag spike to die down.

came back to an afk warning message, fair enough i wasnt at the keyboard for 4 minutes.

Finish the rest of the game.

5 20 minute low prio queue games.

Excuse me but what? so your saying if i afk for 4 minutes during a 4000ms ping spike that made it so i was unable to play at all in the first place, that i deserve the same punishment as someone that dc's at the start of the game and doesnt come back?

That doesnt fit the equal crime equal time mentality at all.

And thats the other thing, its not like riot cant implement a simple ping check, just ping the ip and check the result if its over a certain value and the average ping for the game is much lower than that then chances are they werent afk by choice.

replies.body: You don't just start off with a 20 minute lpq it takes a LOT of leaves and Afks to build up that kind of restriction

It really doesn't, ive only had 20 minute lpq's since the day i made this account.

And ive only had lpq i think 4 times? in the last year.

Only one of which was because i genuinely afk'd

The other 3 times have been from short mid game afk's that are out of my control.

you deserve it at least for all the shitposting you do on boards.
fuck off no one likes it when you complain. no one wants to hear the whining of a manchild over a fucking video game.

> [{quoted}](name=Rengorax,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=MEI82AY7,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2016-06-15T12:49:42.092+0000)
>
> The hypocrite shrivels me up.

at least I'm not a retard that bought SGU.
Dude I have a summoner icon and that is the only thing you can bash me for? Man you are sad...
Pls more salt, I have some meat I need to season.

You chose to play while your internet wasn't stable.
You made the decision to not play while in a game.

Your choices led you to being punished.
It's not Riot's fault you chose to break the rules.

No i didnt.

I chose to play while i had 50ms.

Then one of my housemates decided to start torrenting mid game.

Come back when you develop the ability to see into the future then you can say what you just said.

Granted, if you could see into the future like you expect me to, youd have known id reply with this, and never posted that in the first place.

Typically when one has house mates you decide an order upon things such as torrenting.
Like limiting one's bandwidth usage so you don't inconvenience others.

Or hell, I bought my modem and pay 90% of the internet bill so I have full control over it and act whenever someone starts using more bandwidth than I deem their contributions to allow.

Since being implemented Leaver Buster has warned me twice, roughly 6-8 months apart.
You are fully in control when it comes down to being hit with the extended queue timer.

Yeah unfortunately we have a telstra router with its extremely limited firmware.

We cant limit bandwidth or anything.

And there isnt much chance of us getting the people here to do it of their own attrition, like most of us here are alright, its just one or two offenders who have no concept of "dont do shit that inhibits others"

Like for instance this one guy, despite it literally saying on his lease that he cant have people over for multiple day periods he has his misses and his mates over like every day, and naturally they all have the wifi password (despite him not paying for the net)

But eh what are you gonna do.

Regardless my issue wasnt that I got a punishment per se, more the severity of it compared to the actual offense itself.

5 20 minute queues is a little under 2 hours of lpq.

Then when you throw the already 20 minute queue time on top of that, and then assume every game lasts half an hour, it can easily take 7-8 hours to clear those lpq's

So 8 hours of lpq for 4 minutes of being afk.

And then you turn around and have people just leave 10 games in a row outright and they get exactly the same punishment.

It just desensitizes the person to the punishment.

It's based on a percentage of games that you play.

A friend of mine got hit with queue penalty because he played one game after 6 months of not playing and he got hit with leaver buster in it.

I only get warnings because I play a massive amount of games each month.

It's the same as the report system and feeder detection.
I had several games over the last week where I wasn't able to play to my best and practically fed, but those are like 5 games out of the 40+ I'll play during the month, so they will be quickly forgotten by the system.
